question: What are the names of projects that are related to disaster and have a start date later than 2021?
sub_query: Names of projects related to disaster
Projects with start date later than 2021
final_answer: The projects related to disaster with a start date later than 2021 are Guardrail Replacement Citywide, Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs, and Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs. Additionally, projects such as Annual Street Maintenance (scheduled to start in Summer 2021), Bluffs Park Shade Structure (set to begin construction in Fall 2021), and Vehicle Protection Devices project (expected to start construction in Fall 2021) are also related to disaster and have start dates later than 2021.
sub_answers: Guardrail Replacement Citywide, Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs, Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs.

Annual Street Maintenance is a project with a scheduled start date of Summer 2021. Bluffs Park Shade Structure is another project set to begin construction in Fall 2021. Vehicle Protection Devices project is expected to start construction in Fall 2021.

Disaster Projects (Construction) 
None at this time 
 
Disaster Projects (Completed) 
 
Citywide Guardrail Replacement 
Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged guardrails throughout 
the City caused by the Woolsey Fire on Encinal Canyon Road, Corral Canyon Road, and 
Kanan Dume Road.  The project was combined with the County of Los Angeles’ damaged 
guardrails.  The project was completed in February 2021. 
 
Malibu Park Storm Drain Repairs 
Project Description:  After the Woolsey Fire, subsequent storms caused damage to 
multiple storm drain facilities throughout Malibu.  The project repaired the storm drains on 
Cuthbert Road, Morning View Drive, Busch Drive at Harvester Road.  The project also 
included the repair of a storm drainage facility on Birdview Avenue.

after the Woolsey Fire.  The City will create a complete inventory of storm 
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures 
within the City.   
¾ Updates:  Council approved an agreement in December for design services.  
A kick-off meeting was held in late December.

 Completion Date:  Spring 2022

¾ Project Description:  This project consisted of replacing the damaged

Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA Project)

Malibu Park Drainage Improvements 
¾ Updates: The Contractor completed the repairs to storm drains on Cuthbert 
Road, Morning View Drive, Busch Drive, Harvester Road and Birdview

January 24, 2022 meeting. 
 
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project) 
¾ Project Description:  This project consists of design and construction of a few 
storm drains on Clover Heights.  The existing storm drain facility ends at the 
intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.  During storms, this 
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.  An extended storm 
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue. 
¾ Updates: 
 Staff is currently preparing consultant proposals for the design of this 
project.  Proposals will be due in February/March.

Civic Center Way Improvements  
¾ Updates:  
 Work Hours: Monday through Friday 7:00AM to 4:00PM, Saturdays 
7:00AM to 4:00PM 
 The contractor is currently working at the section between Vista 
Pacifica and the condos on Civic Center Way.  This phase of work will 
require the temporary closure of Civic Center Way.  Portions of the 
curb and gutter have been placed and the contactor is working on the 
proposed retaining wall.  This portion of work is anticipated to be 
completed in early February 2021. 
 The contractor is also working on the curb, gutter and storm drain 
installation on Civic Center Way from Webb Way to the condos.  This 
portion of the work may require temporary road closures.  However, it 
is anticipated that this phase of the project will be completed at the 
end of February 2021. 
¾ Project Schedule: August 2020 through March 2021

Vehicle Protection Devices 
¾ Project Description:  Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires 
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces 
located adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area.  There are two 
locations within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would 
require a vehicle impact protection device. 
¾ Estimated Schedule: 
 Complete Design: Summer 2021 
 Begin Construction: Fall 2021
